author:
Shane Covey
scovey@reformer.com @ShaneCovey on Twitter
title: Bellows Falls shuts out visiting Brattleboro
text:
Bellows Falls shuts out visiting Brattleboro 
By Shane Covey Posted: 10/12/2015 07:39:22 PM EDT Updated: 10/12/2015 07:39:23 PM EDT 
WESTMINSTER >> On Columbus Day, those that got to see the Bellows Falls varsity field hockey team for the first time made a discovery of their own. 
BF's defense is really good. 
The Terriers only gave up two shots and got their eighth shutout of the season, blanking visiting Brattleboro 3-0 on a beautiful 70-degree afternoon. 
"I think my defense is awesome. They were pretty solid," said Bellows Falls coach Bethany Coursen, who went with three defenders on Monday instead of her team's usual four. "With just three players back there, they did an amazing job." 
That's for sure. 
Murphy Hicks made some long drives out of danger, Paxton Santorelli made some clears by carrying the ball out, and defender Emily Stoddard had another outstanding game — Vermont's September Athlete of the Month nominee trapped an opponent in the corner, made a couple of steals, got the fans excited with a nice run along the sideline, and also dribbled all the way across the field before passing ahead to a cutting Reagan Baldasaro. 
The Terriers outshot the Colonels 10-2 and had a 7-0 advantage in penalty corners. 
"I think our corners are getting a little more consistent," stated Coursen, whose team used them to build a 2-0 halftime lead. Advertisement 
Sophia Hyslop put away a pass from Dani Marchica, 10:41 into the contest, to get the hosts on the board. And then Macie Streeter tapped in Leia Robinson's feed for an insurance goal with 10:03 left before the break. 
It could have been worse had Brattleboro's Hannah Wilson, Marly Lynch, Madison Fortier and Laura Freeman not gotten takeaways inside the circle. Kharisma Boyd chipped in by clearing the ball out via a long rally and sweeper Hannah Blake was often seen fronting Robinson on the weak side. 
"They're a very good team and we're still in the learning process," noted Brattleboro co-coach Sherryl Libardoni, whose team has eight freshmen and 10 sophomores on its roster. "I thought that each section (defense, links, forwards) played well, but our transition game wasn't working." 
Brattleboro netminders Olivia Weeks and Nataylia Forkin combined for seven saves. With the hosts seemingly threatening all day long, they kicked away difficult shots by Averie Lowe, Macie Streeter, Hannah Kelly (2), Dani Marchica, Molly Kelly and Leia Robinson. 
Forkin, who defended the goal in the second half, didn't have much of a chance with 3:43 remaining. Baldasaro attacked down the right side and crossed the ball in front to Abbe Cravinho, who drove it into the back of the net to cap the scoring. 
Brattleboro's chances all came during a two-minute span in the second half. Emily Crespo passed ahead to Olivia Reil in close and Lynch later rolled the ball into the slot, but BF goalie Emma Lober stood her ground each time. 
The 7-2-2 Terriers, who will play at Woodstock on Wednesday, are atop the Division 3 standings. The Colonels (2-9-2) need to tie or beat Fair Haven on Saturday in order to make it into the Division 1 playoffs. Brattleboro roster 
Coaches — Sherryl Libardoni and Kelly Markol. Players — Jenna Scott, Kylee Shatrau, Laura Freeman, Molly Durling, Kayla Leonard-Houle, Meera Seery, Amber Lockwood, Olivia Reil, Hannah Blake, Gracie Frost, Nataylia Forkin, Kalin Noble, Brook Ellis, Olivia Weeks, Keegan Jameson, Emily Crespo, Madison Fortier, Hannah Wilson, Katie Taggard, Kharisma Boyd, Kyleigh Peterson, Marly Lynch, Mya McAuliffe. Bellows Falls roster 
Coach — Bethany Coursen. Players — Abbe Cravinho, Regan Baldasaro, Leia Robinson, Dani Marchica, Molly Kelly, Sophia Hyslop, Ellie Guyon, Hannah Kelly, Macie Streeter, Fallon Vancor, Averie Lowe, Aly Bashaw, Paxton Santorelli, Murphy Hicks, Emily Stoddard, Faith Byfield, Brigid Hodsden, Emma Lober.
